item.title: Genshin Impact: Envisaged Echoes Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?
  • How To Obtain Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?
  • How To Unlock Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?

In Genshin Impact ’s Version 4.7, a new endgame gameplay mode called Imaginarium Theater was introduced. The schedule lasts for a month, and within each season, players need to equip various characters based on their elemental characteristics for the relevant battle.

Imaginarium Theater is somewhat similar to Spiral Abyss in Genshin Impact, and once players begin to familiarize themselves with it, they’ll soon begin to enjoy the additional rewards. Envisaged Echoes are a new trait introduced to the Imaginarium Theater and are basically character trail effects. Here’s how you can obtain them and what exactly they do to your characters.

What Are Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?

These are new character effects, something similar to cosmetics that can be added to characters that you own. These are special effects that trail behind characters when they move.

How To Obtain Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?

After completing some Imaginarium Theater challenges, players will obtain Keys of Echoes each season. You can use these keys to unlock the Envisaged Echoes of the given characters in the list. Players will need two Keys of Echoes for each character, and only one key will be provided each season . Once you have unlocked it, you then have to complete the given challenge with that character to obtain the character trail effect.

How To Unlock Envisaged Echoes In Genshin Impact?

In order to unlock the Envisaged Echoes, your character needs to reach a certain eligibility for it. This means that there’s a set requirement for each character challenge to obtain it.

Your characters need to be Level 90 and have reached Friendship Level 8 to even enter the Envisaged Echoes challenge.

It will be comforting to know that you can indeed unlock the challenges and then come back to them when your character is of the right eligibility. Also, all players need to keep in mind that these character trails are only available for characters that are already owned .

Once you unlock the challenges and are allowed to enter them, there will be individual challenges you have to complete to obtain the character trail effect. After doing so, just head to the character menu, equip it from the dressing room, and enjoy the effects!

item.title: Once Human: 7 Best Fishing Locations
item.description:
Highlights

  • Once Human offers a mix of survival gameplay and pet capturing in a horror setting, with a free-to-play model and optional subscriptions.
  • Fishing in the game may not be complex, but it's useful for food recipes and catching unique deviants, making locations like Wild Dog Isle appealing.
  • Locations like Brookham Dock and Chalk Peak Delta offer more than just fishing, allowing players to farm resources and enjoy various elements of gameplay.

Once Human is an interesting mix of survival gameplay in a horror setting, with additional gameplay elements such as pet capturing, and a great storyline. The game is free to play, with cosmetics available for sale in the cash shop. There is also a monthly subscription available that gives additional benefits.

Most survival games offer fishing as an activity. Some make it a core gameplay mechanic, others simply include it for completion's sake. Fishing in Once Human is actually quite basic, but it is useful for two reasons. Firstly, the player can use the fish that they catch as ingredients for food crafting recipes. Secondly, there are deviants that can only be caught while the player is fishing. There are better fishing implementations in other survival games, but the fishing in Once Human is adequate.

7 Wild Dog Isle

Great For New Players

New players who are looking for a good place to start their fishing career in Once Human , could do worse than swim across to Wild Dog Isle. This location is close to a PvP zone that is usually claimed by a warband, so be careful not to enter the zone by mistake.

What makes Wild Dog Isle a great fishing spot, is the fact that apart from the first day of a game season, this area is almost deserted of players. This means that fishing fans can have the entire place to themselves, with no pesky players running around.

6 Brookham Dock

Fishing And Acid Farming In One

Some players might find fishing a tad boring. And in all honesty, the fishing system in Once Human is not exactly complex or engaging, it can be something of a grind trying to catch enough fish to craft recipes. Heading to somewhere like Brookham Dock could spice things up.

Brookham is a polluted zone, and the player will find that deviants will spawn whilst they are fishing, which they will have to deal with. The bonus here, is that these deviants will also drop acid, a resource all players need.

5 Harborside Bridge

Easy Fishing

Harborside is an interesting POI based on a sunken, flooded town. Because it is flooded, the water level comes up to the edge of the main road bridge in the town. This makes it a very easy, uncluttered location to fish from.

Landing fish from the bridge is extremely easy indeed. The only downside for low-level players is that level-12 alligators often spawn in the area. Players who can’t defend themselves from these critters should consider fishing elsewhere, or keep their eyes open and run away from the alligator if they are targeted by one.

4 Greywater Camp

Close To A Teleporter

Some players like to fish in short bursts, as an activity to fill up a few minutes when waiting for something, such as group members to be ready for an activity. Greywater Camp is a great fishing location for this kind of gameplay.

There is a river right outside of the settlement, and, of course, the settlement itself has a hand teleportation tower inside. It is possible to teleport into the settlement, walk outside, and be fishing within seconds. When the player needs to leave, they just pack up their fishing rod and head back to the teleporter.

3 Holt Town Decking

Exciting Fishing In A Polluted Zone

Holt Town is an excellent acid farming location, and it also has a very comfortable fishing area out on the rear decking at the back of the town. Here, players can fish, and then farm a little acid every few minutes as the handful of deviants on the decking respawn.

Landing fish can be a little tricky here though, as the decking is quite a way above the water. It takes a gentle hand to land fish without snapping the line here. However, for players who want to spice up their fishing with a little peril, this is a great location in this survival shooter.

2 Chalk Peak Delta

Miles Of Waterways

As remote fishing locations go, it is hard to find anywhere better than Chalk Peak Delta in Once Human . Several rivers combine into a large estuary, meaning there are miles of fishable banks, many with gently sloping beaches, where the fish can be seen swimming easily.

This location is over on the western edge of the open-world map, almost at the map boundary, so players need to be careful that they do not go out of bounds, resulting in death. However, for real fishing aficionados, this is a fantastic place to get some fishing in.

1 Tall Grass Inn Dock

Catch An Electric Eel

Tall Grass In is the second to last settlement that a Once Human player will visit as part of the storyline. It has a very nice dock within the boundaries of the settlement. This means that the player has direct access to a local teleportation station, and can quickly depart for elsewhere if they need to.

It has been confirmed that the Electric Eel deviant can be captured from this doc. This is a very useful deviant, as once it has been put into a securement container, it will boost the amount of electricity produced by generators within a player base. Multiple can be captured to give a significant boost in power output.

item.title: Genshin Impact: How To Reach The Secret Room On Whispering Isle
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock The Towards The Lighthouse, Or Far Away Quest
  • How To Enter The Secret Room Underneath Whispering Isle

The Summertide Scales and Tales event in Genshin Impact has three main areas for Travelers to explore. The areas unlock through the main quest line and in the final one, players will be introduced to Broken Isle. Broken Isle is where the main finale of the story takes place and where Travelers will battle the fearsome dragon.

After completing it, they’ll gain access to all the islands in the area and world quests. One specific world quest in Genshin Impact is ‘Towards The Lighthouse, Or Far Away’ and it introduces players to the furthest island in the area - Whispering Isle. You can head to the island without the quest, but it will be easier to unlock everything on the island and head there after following the quest, NPC Panuelle.

How To Unlock The Towards The Lighthouse, Or Far Away Quest

You can find Esnoir beneath the Brickstacks Lighthouse. He will have a blue world quest icon above his head and once you interact with him, just continue on with the quest until you reach Whispering Isle. You’ll meet another NPC named Panuelle midway on the Highest Island that Esnoir asked you to go to.

Panuelle is the one who will guide you to the Whispering Isle as he requires help in making a wish to the three Goddesses of Fate. Follow the quest navigation and make offerings to the Goddesses to complete the quest and unlock Whispering Isle. Players should note that the offerings will be located in Brickstacks, so you will have to teleport back and forth to find the pieces. Remember to follow the floating stars during the quest as they will lead you to some additional chests.

How To Enter The Secret Room Underneath Whispering Isle

After you have completed the World Quest, head back to Whispering Isle and go behind the middle statue. Head to the edge of the cliff and interact with the dialogue “Observations”. Then, jump off the ledge, and you’ll immediately turn into a star trail. This will fly you underneath the island and into a small crack.

You’ll land in the room and a Luxurious Chest will then spawn. Claim the chest and if you look around, you might even recognize the props from all the previous Genshin Impact summer events. Players can interact with each of the props in the room and read some of the designated dialogues. If you head towards the bookshelf, you’ll find a note with some lore background that might also be appealing to some players that enjoy finding such clues.

item.description: Start your adventure into Dawn here with general tips about combat, gear, and more.

item.title: 10 Survival Games That Make You Feel Vulnerable
item.description:
Highlights

  • Survival games immerse players in realistic worlds where every move can mean life or death.
  • These games offer challenging tasks like hunting and crafting, making survival not easy.
  • Players in survival games battle elements, adversaries, and their own minds, creating vulnerable experiences.

In a survival game , players are conscious of the choices that they make - just one wrong move could be the difference between life and death. These highly-immersive worlds seem real to them; here, resources are scarce, and danger is always lurking around the corner, ready to take them by surprise, and even a small cut on the hand could lead to death if not treated in time. This vulnerability that players feel is what sets survival games apart from other genres.

Here, the goal isn't just to exist, but rather, players are battling the elements, adversaries, and sometimes even their own minds. Below, we've curated a list of the best survival games that make players feel vulnerable.

10 UnReal World

Survival Sandbox Set In Iron Age Finland

  • Platforms : PC, macOS, Linux
  • Release : 1992
  • Developer : Sami Maaranen, Erkka Lehmus

UnReal World is a popular game in the survival genre, and it offers a distinctive, old-school experience that is loved by a multitude of fans for its simulation elements. At the beginning of the game, players' chosen character is dropped into a simulated fictional world that's inspired by Iron Age Finland. However, though it is also considered to be a part of the fantasy genre, there aren't a lot of fantastical elements, especially at first, because the game offers an in-depth survival experience where even performing a basic task, such as catching a squirrel, can be challenging.

Also, players may take some time to become familiar with the interface - to call it archaic would be an understatement - but once they get the hang of the controls, the game will start to progressively get better. Players can do almost everything here, but survival does not come easy.

9 Medieval Dynasty

Survival RPG With Medieval Life Simulation

The goal of this game is for players to create their own dynasty instead of being the typical lone survivor who is trapped in an unfamiliar environment. It follows a fairly elaborate storyline that brings together survival, RPG, and city-building mechanics. This game is more streamlined in its survival mechanics when compared to a lot of the other games on this list.

However, what makes Medieval Dynasty so intriguing is the ability for players to create their own village and all the mechanics that surround it. Although players oversee the entire village, they only have to focus on the survival of the protagonist. This makes this game an interesting pick in the survival genre.

8 Neo Scavenger

Survival RPG With Permadeath And Complex Choices

This turn-based survival game is set in a strange, post-apocalyptic world. To players, it will feel like they have immersed themselves in one of the most elaborate choose-your-own-adventure books. The hex-based map and limited series of actions make it so that almost every choice has a consequence, with scavenging being a central part of the gameplay.

To elaborate, Neo Scavenger offers an in-depth combat simulation where players are provided multiple options, most of which, when chosen, will end in failure. It is uniquely compelling, driving players to try their best to uncover the game's secrets, regardless of how difficult the challenges may seem.

7 Ancestors: The Humankind Odyssey

A Survival Game Spanning Human Evolution

This is quite a dense and complex game that can very easily become frustrating; however, it does offer a unique experience. The goal is nothing less than to ensure the evolution of mankind. Players start out as ape-like proto-humans in prehistoric Africa, and their aim is to gather knowledge, learn skills, and pass all of it on to the next generations, eventually leading to the evolution of humans.

What makes this game so tough, especially at first, is that players pretty much start with nothing. The actual controls are surprisingly responsive and controller-friendly, but everything else is a mystery; a good deal of exploration and experimentation is required. Ancestors: The Humankind Odyssey had mixed responses at first, rightfully so, since it can be unforgiving at times.

6 RimWorld

Dynamic Storytelling With Colony Management And AI

RimWorld can be considered a combination of the survival genre with elements of The Sims, making it a unique game. The developers call it a storytelling tool, and the majority of the entertainment is just seeing how things play out. The AI systems in this game are as good as it gets, and it is those systems that make this game feel realistic, providing players with an immersive experience.

Additionally, the graphics can take a little getting used to, and the actual command system can be somewhat confusing to new players, but it all does not matter a whole lot, as the real joy of this game is just seeing the colonists interact with each other.

5 Green Hell

Survival In A Realistic And Harsh Amazon Rainforest

What makes Green Hell really stand out is how realistic the game is. Players won't feel that anything is exaggerated, it is just them against the elements in the Amazon rainforest. A huge part of the gameplay is understanding how to deal with the different conditions that would either have to be avoided or tackled while traveling through the jungle.

Also, when players deal with illnesses, they must keep in mind that even the smallest thing, like a rash, can lead to hallucinations that may drive them insane. If they are not healthy, they may lose the will to live. Most of the game is about dealing with the mundane parts of survival, such as crafting tools, building shelters, and finding food, thus adding a layer of realism and challenge to the entire experience.

4 The Forest

Survival Horror With Crafting And Open-World Exploration

The Forest is a game that fits well into both the horror and survival genres, offering an entertaining gaming experience for players. The survival mechanics are realistic, and players are required to keep their health, hunger, and stamina in check while crafting stools and scavenging for resources. The storyline follows a plane crash survivor who is desperately in search of his son on an unknown island.

Here, the player must fend off attacks from monstrous mutants and cannibals who reside on the island, and this factor of horror and survival makes it one of the most immersive and entertaining survival games around. Despite the supernatural aspects, it still has a realistic feel.

3 This War Of Mine

A Survival Game From Civilians' Perspective

This game offers a somber experience where players control a group of civilians who are trying to survive a war in an unnamed Eastern European country. What makes this game stand out is that it does not depict some fantastical scenario like most other games on the list. Players are just regular humans doing their best to get through the perilous situation they're in.

The depiction of desperation during this time adds to its realism, and depending on the player's actions, it can even lead to them becoming depressed or suicidal. The overall experience of This War of Mine is very bleak, and the game is an accurate representation of how wars are brutal, and the impact that they have on common folk.

2 Project Zomboid

Open-World Zombie Survival With Deep Simulation Mechanics

This list would be incomplete without a zombie game. Project Zomboid takes the premise of a zombie apocalypse and makes things as realistic as possible, which is another way to say that players are going to have a hard time! This game is incredibly tough; players start off as lone survivors at the beginning, and the goal is simply to survive, which is much easier said than done.

The zombies are relentless in this game, and it only takes a few of them to take the player down. Though the graphics are simple and retro-styled, the simulation is quite in-depth - there's crafting, building, farming, character development, and more. Overall, the complex systems and attention to detail make it one of the most realistic zombie games out there.

1 The Long Dark

Survival In A Frozen Wilderness

Set in the remote regions of Canada after a mysterious geomagnetic storm takes out any existing form of modern technology, the goal of the game is just to survive. The most important thing in The Long Dark is for players to keep warm; however, everything is temporary. The actual survival simulation in this game is not that complex, but the constant need for players to repair and replenish their gear will create a dire sense of urgency.

Things can get desolate over the course of the game, especially if players are just playing in Sandbox Mode. This is a laser-focused survival game in a harsh winter environment, and while it is not as complicated as the others on our list, very few games really have the power to capture the feeling of loneliness and desperation in the way this one does.
